## Properties

| **Property**              | **Values**                           | **Default** |
| ------------------------- | ------------------------------------ | ----------- |
| Size `Variant`            | `Sm \| Md \| Lg \| Xl \| 2Xl`        | `Md`        |
| Has start item `Boolean`  | `true \| false`                      | `true`      |
| Start item `InstanceSwap` | `Icon \| Checkbox \| Radio \| Asset` | `Icon`      |
| Label `Text`              | `string`                             | `Label`     |
| Has end item `Boolean`    | `true \| false`                      | `false`     |
| End item `InstanceSwap`   | `Icon \| Checkbox \| Radio \| Asset` | `Icon`      |

## When to use

{<svg width="20" height="20" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" style={{ display: 'inline', verticalAlign: 'middle' }}><path d="M5 13l4 4L19 7" style={{ stroke: "var(--text-positive)" }} strokeWidth="2" /></svg>} Use for structured lists, such as settings, navigation menus and dropdowns. <br/>
{<svg width="20" height="20" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" style={{ display: 'inline', verticalAlign: 'middle' }}><path d="M5 13l4 4L19 7" style={{ stroke: "var(--text-positive)" }} strokeWidth="2" /></svg>} Sort lists in a logical way to help users scan the content, such as alphabetical, numerical, chronological order. <br/>
{<svg width="20" height="20" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" style={{ display: 'inline', verticalAlign: 'middle' }}><path d="M5 13l4 4L19 7" style={{ stroke: "var(--text-positive)" }} strokeWidth="2" /></svg>} Use icons, images and text in a consistent pattern. <br/><br/>
{<svg width="20" height="20" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" style={{ display: 'inline', verticalAlign: 'middle' }}><path d="M6 6L18 18M6 18L18 6" style={{ stroke: "var(--text-negative)" }} strokeWidth="2" /></svg>} Don't overload the list with elements if the clarity suffers. <br/>
{<svg width="20" height="20" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" style={{ display: 'inline', verticalAlign: 'middle' }}><path d="M6 6L18 18M6 18L18 6" style={{ stroke: "var(--text-negative)" }} strokeWidth="2" /></svg>} Don't use for dense data, consider using table instead. <br/>

## Behaviour

Lists display a collection of related list items in a vertical stack, used heavily to provide information structure and readability.
By default, lists display static information, but list items can be configured to be interactive:

- **Static display:** Simple information presentation for consumption (feature lists or contact details).
- **Interactive lists:** Lists can allow for user interaction, including selection (single or multiple) and reordering (drag-and-drop).
- **Dynamic loading:** For very long lists, items might load dynamically as the user scrolls, improving page load performance.

## Size

Dimensions of the list item are tied to the global `scale` tokens. This ensures that the components with similar size settings remain consistent across the interface. `scale` tokens also provides more granular control over dimensional settings.

```css:scale.css showLineNumbers
--scale-height-<size>
--scale-gap-<size>
--scale-icon-size-<size>
--scale-text-size-<size>
--scale-text-height-<size>
```
